history.content:
I think it’s definitely worth showing your efforts in 170 and having an A for 170 would be very beneficial. I would keep it anyway along with the breaths.

But it is also true that if your transcripts looks like A, A, A, P, and that P is for a upper EECS class, then people looking at it would infer that class being a very bad grade. It really depends on what kind of research or job you wanna do in the future though—if you are applying for SWE then grades generally don’t matter too much and the employers won’t even care you PNP a heavy math based class.

I personally would recommend you show the grade if you can have a better grade than B or B+, which is already a decent grade under this situation. If not, then PNP 126 and in case people ask (but I highly doubt anyone would...) just be honest that your learning was affected by this semester’s situation.

Hi everyone, before I begin, I understand that similar questions to mine have been asked to death over here so far. I just thought I'd ask mine as well since there's a slight caveat to my situation (in my opinion).

To elaborate, I'm currently taking 170, 126, and two breadths. The transition to online learning has impacted my efforts in 126 much more than any other class so I know I'll have to PNP it. However, I'm not sure if I should PNP my remaining 3 classes or take them for a letter grade. The thing is, I didn't do great in 70 (got my first B+ in a CS course) and I was hoping to make up for it this semester. And so, I'm currently looking at an A in 170 and my two breadths. This is especially important for me since this is my first A in a CS course (got A- in 61A/B/C). Got an A in 16A/B but don't really think I can count them. I feel 170 being an UD class also helps. Moreover, it would also help overcome my B+ in 70. 

Lastly, I'm hoping to get into research next semester and I feel like having an A on my transcript would be better for my research application then having a B+ as my last grade for a CS course. 

Hence, I wanted to get some advice on whether I should consider taking 170 and my breadths for letter grades and pnp'ing 126, or if I should PNP all of them even with the above situation?
history.subject: Pick-and-choose for first A or PNP everything?
